page.title: 13CHIPPING WARDEN SCHOOL
page.content: Chipping Warden School used to be a hospital for the airfield during the second world war. It became a school in the early 1950's. It is a single storey, rambling building with long corrdors. At present there are 35 children in the school. There are three classrooms. One is an art room, one is a maths and science room and the other is the language room. We have a big hall with a stage and a dining room. All these rooms used to be the wards or the operating theatre of the hospital. We have two teachers, Mrs Howse and Mrs Ormond. The oldest pupil is Neil Partis. We are allowed to roller skate at playtime. There are lots of pictures and writing around the school that the children have done. The original school was close to the church and had a small yard. We have a very big playground.
